court:
HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR
respondents: REPRESENTED BY THE SHO(STATION HOUSE OFFICER),
outcome:
ORDER
Dated this the 9th day of January, 2020

The petitioners are accused in S.C. No. 849/2018
pending on the files of the 2™ Additional Assistant Sessions
Court, Ernakulam. It is submitted that there is a counter
case which was pending before the Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court, Njarakkal as C.C. No.947/2018. Being a
case and counter case, steps were taken for both the cases
being tried by the same court, and it is submitted by the
learned counsel for the petitioners that the case pending
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Njarakkal
has now been committed to the Sessions Court and the
allotment of the said case to the 2™ Additional Assistant
Sessions Court is awaited.

2. The prayer in this petition is only to defer the trial
of S.C. No.849/2018 for such period as may be directed by
this court. There is an interim stay already granted by this
court. In view of the fact that the counter case has also been

Ee, Stet]
Crl.MC.No.6457 OF 2019(F) 2020/KER/LO37
4

transferred to the Sessions division, both the cases can be
tried together by the same court.

With these observations, the petition is disposed

Crl.MC.No.6457 OF 2019 (F) 2020/KER/TO37

ORDER
Dated this the 9th day of January, 2020

The petitioners are accused in S.C. No. 849/2018
pending on the files of the 2™ Additional Assistant Sessions
Court, Ernakulam. It is submitted that there is a counter
case which was pending before the Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court, Njarakkal as C.C. No.947/2018. Being a
case and counter case, steps were taken for both the cases
being tried by the same court, and it is submitted by the
learned counsel for the petitioners that the case pending
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Njarakkal
has now been committed to the Sessions Court and the
allotment of the said case to the 2™ Additional Assistant
Sessions Court is awaited.

2. The prayer in this petition is only to defer the trial
of S.C. No.849/2018 for such period as may be directed by
this court. There is an interim stay already granted by this
court. In view of the fact that the counter case has also been

Ee, Stet]
Crl.MC.No.6457 OF 2019(F) 2020/KER/LO37
4

transferred to the Sessions division, both the cases can be
tried together by the same court.

With these observations, the petition is disposed.

Sd/-
ASHOK MENON
JUDGE
